str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A greeting, salutation. From aspazomai; a greeting.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of mneme; to exercise memory, i.e. Recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Or desmos des-mos' neuter and masculine respectively from deo; a band, i.e. Ligament or shackle; figuratively, an impediment or disability.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
